description.narrative: ILEAs help advance U.S. interests through international cooperation while promoting global social, political and economic stability through combating crime. ILEAs provide high quality training and technical assistance, support institution building, enhance enforcement capabilities and foster positive relationships between American law enforcement agencies and their counterparts in each respective region.

participating-org.narrative: U.S. Government - Department of Homeland Security

description.narrative: To further the informational exchange with partner nations by reinforcing inspectional techniques and methodologies with counterpart law enforcement agencies in the host nations own operating environment. Skills previously presented in the US during IBIT by conducting practical exercise at critical port(s) of entry identified by host national. The goal of this program is to help build an internal train-the-trainer capacity and eventually infuse the curriculum into the formal training regimen of the host nation.
